metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0250 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in client/X11/xf_graphics.c in FreeRDP allow remote attackers to have an unspecified impact via the width and height to the (1) xf_Pointer_New or (2) xf_Bitmap_Decompress function, which causes an incorrect amount of memory to be allocated.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp-x11 - 1.1.0~git20140921.1.440916e+dfsg1-5ubuntu1
libfreerdp-cache1.1 - 1.1.0~git20140921.1.440916e+dfsg1-5ubuntu1
libfreerdp-client1.1 - 1.1.0~git20140921.1.440916e+dfsg1-5ubuntu1

criterions.comment: freerdp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0~git20140921.1.440916e+dfsg1-5ubuntu1').
